title: 113_s458
content: The Act titled "Improve Nutrition Program Integrity and Deficit Reduction Act of 2013" aims to restore program integrity to categorical eligibility for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program by amending certain sections of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008. SEC. 3. ELIMINATING THE LOW-INCOME HOME ENERGY ASSISTANCE LOOPHOLE. Section 5 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 is amended to exclude certain payments under the Social Security Act or other State programs. Subsection (e)(6)(C) removes clause (iv), and subsection (k) reorganizes paragraphs and subparagraphs. Section 2605(f) of the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Act of 1981 is amended by removing paragraph (1) and (2) respectively. SEC. 4 eliminates inflation adjustments for countable resources in the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008. SEC. 5 ends Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits for lottery or gambling winners. Section 6 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 is amended to include ineligibility for benefits for households with members receiving substantial lottery or gambling winnings. The household remains ineligible until meeting financial resources and income eligibility requirements. State agencies must comply with agreements set by the Secretary. State agencies must establish agreements with gaming entities to determine if individuals on the supplemental nutrition assistance program have received significant lottery or gambling winnings. Amendments to the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 expand ineligibility for benefits to households with members receiving such winnings. Compliance with Secretary-set agreements is required. SEC. 6. ELIMINATING STATE BONUSES. Section 16 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 is amended by removing subsection (d) and making conforming amendments to subsections (c) and (i)(1). In Section 16 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008, subsection (d) is removed and amendments are made to subsections (c) and (i)(1) by changing the reference from "subsection (d)(1)" to "subsection (c)(2)". SEC. 7. ELIMINATING DUPLICATIVE EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING. Funding for employment and training programs under the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 is amended. Administrative cost-sharing provisions are also adjusted to exclude certain programs. Conforming amendments are made to related sections of the Act. The Nutrition Act of 2008 is amended to remove certain subsections. Workfare provisions are also adjusted by striking subsection (g) in related sections of the Act. SEC. 8 amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 by adjusting emergency food assistance resources. SEC. 9 repeals the nutrition education grant program. SEC. 10 terminates an increase in benefits. SEC. 10 terminates an increase in benefits after February 1, 2013.
